name: Connes embedding problem
summary: The Connes Embedding Problem (CEP) is a fundamental question in mathematics that asked if every tracial von Neumann algebra could be approximated by finite-dimensional matrix algebras. In simpler terms, it questioned if complex, infinite-dimensional systems could be faithfully represented by simpler, finite systems. While it remained a central open problem for decades, the problem was proven to have a negative solution as a corollary of a 2020 result in quantum complexity theory called MIP*=RE.
head: The Connes Embedding Problem has a positive answer (i.e., all tracial von Neumann algebras can be approximated by finite-dimensional matrices).
tall: A certain related decision problem in logic is decidable, or a certain set of quantum correlations is equal to another set of correlations (Tsirelson's problem) or the Halting Problem would be decidable.
